name: df-dic
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(cdic, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cfv(clh, cv(s0)), cmpt(s2, crab(s3, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), copab(s4, s5, wa(wceq(cv(s4), cfv(cv(s5), crio(s6, cfv(cfv(cltrn, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s6), cfv(cfv(coc, cv(s0)), cv(s1))), cv(s2))))), wcel(cv(s5), cfv(cfv(ctendo, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ DIsoC =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(LHyp ` s0)‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà { s3 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0)| ¬¨ s3[(le ` s0)]s1 } ‚Ü¶ { < s4, s5 > |(s4 =(s5 ` iota(s6 ‚àà((LTrn ` s0)` s1),(s6 `((oc ` s0)` s1))= s2))‚àß s5 ‚àà((TEndo ` s0)` s1))})))
comment: Isomorphism C has domain of lattice atoms that are not less than or equal to the fiducial co-atom ` w ` . The value is a one-dimensional subspace generated by the pair consisting of the ` iota_ ` vector below and the endomorphism ring unit. Definition of phi(q) in [Crawley] p. 121. Note that we use the fixed atom ` ( ( oc ` k ) ` w ) ` to represent the p in their "Choose an atom p..." on line 21. (Contributed by NM, 15-Dec-2013.)
